facts.fact_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday, reversing a two-day advance as easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured prices.

facts.fact_text: Iran confirmed it will hold negotiations with the US in Oman on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Iran confirmed it will hold negotiations with the US in Oman on Friday, reducing the immediate risk of military conflict and potential supply disruptions from the major OPEC producer.

facts.fact_text: The Middle East accounts for about a third of global crude supply.

evidences.evidence_text: The news eased some of the geopolitical risk premium tied to the Middle East, which accounts for about a third of global crude supply.

facts.fact_text: The US and Russia agreed to resume high level military contacts.

evidences.evidence_text: Traders are also monitoring Ukraine developments after renewed Russian attacks on energy infrastructure, while the US and Russia agreed to resume high level military contacts.

claims.claim_text: Easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured oil prices.

evidences.evidence_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday, reversing a two-day advance as easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured prices.

claims.claim_text: Weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand.

evidences.evidence_text: Prices also came under pressure after weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand.

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty remains over whether Washington and Tehran can bridge key differences, keeping some risk premium in the market.

evidences.evidence_text: Still, uncertainty remains over whether Washington and Tehran can bridge key differences, keeping some risk premium in the market.

evidence.evidence_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday, reversing a two-day advance as easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured prices.
WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday, reversing a two-day advance as easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured prices.
Prices also came under pressure after weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand.
Prices also came under pressure after weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand.

The news eased some of the geopolitical risk premium tied to the Middle East, which accounts for about a third of global crude supply.
